thread.title: Wonder Boys check in at 24th in AFCA
thread.title_full: Wonder Boys check in at 24th in AFCA

author: ATU Athletic Communications (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Wonder Boys check in at 24th in AFCA
text: Wonder Boys check in at 24th in AFCA by ATU Athletic Communications The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:40 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 54 views | 0 | 0 | | After this weekend’s 30-12 victory over then-No. 20 Ouachita Baptist, the Arkansas Tech Wonder Boys football team (5-1, 5-1 Great American Conference) has entered the American Football Coaches Association Top-25 Poll for the first time since the final poll of the 2009 season, checking in at No. 24 in this week’s poll.The Wonder Boys are one of two Great American Conference squads to be ranked in this week’s poll, as Henderson State re-entered the poll at No. 19 after edging Harding 22-17.Tech and Henderson enter the season’s seventh week tied atop the GAC standings with identical 5-1 records. The Reddies are in action this week at Arkansas-Monticello while the Wonder Boys are also on the road against an East Central team that is also receiving votes in this week’s poll.Harding also received votes in this week’s poll.Tech enters the poll after a near-record performance by Wonder Boys freshman Bryan Allen, who rushed for 279 yards in the Wonder Boys’ Homecoming win. Allen’s rushing total was nine yards shy of the school record of 288 yards, set by Travis Horn in the 2001 season against Central Arkansas.Bryan Allen picks up Co-Offensive Player of the WeekAfter a banner game that saw him rack up the second-most rushing yards in Arkansas Tech history, freshman running back Bryan Allen was selected by the Great American Conference as Co-Offensive Player of the Week.Allen’s 279 rushing yards was second only to Travis Horn’s 288 yards in 2001 against Central Arkansas, and his offensive performance paced a Wonder Boys offense that racked up 374 yards on the ground in a 30-12 win over then-No. 20 Ouachita Baptist.His performance helped lift the Wonder Boys into the national rankings for the first time since the 2009 season, as Arkansas Tech checked in at No. 24 in this week’s AFCA poll.Allen shares POW honors with Arkansas-Monticello signal caller Hunter Leppert, who threw for 398 yards and five scores against Southern Nazarene.The No. 24 Wonder Boys are back in action this Saturday, traveling to Ada, Okla. to face off against the East Central University Tigers. Kickoff is set for 2 p.m.
